definition: to hit/to strike/to attack/to crack down on sth/blow/(psychological) shock/percussion (music)
to attack/to accuse/to charge/an attack (terrorist or military)
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
sudden and violent attack/assault/fig. rushed job/concentrated effort to finish a job quickly
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident

sentences.english: Then he punches Tweener in the chest.
Jack swung a slow, heavy right hand at Tom.
sentences.chinese: 杰克慢慢挥起右手，朝汤姆重重地击了一掌。

sentences.english: More strange is the lingbi stone do rock.
sentences.chinese: 更奇的是击之灵璧石做的磐。

sentences.english: Three times he struck the shield with the shaft.
sentences.chinese: 他用矛柄击了银盾三下。

sentences.english: The blow on his head stunned him for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 击在他头上的一拳使他有一阵儿昏了过去。

sentences.english: Thus, when you hit a punching bag, it bounces right back at you.
sentences.chinese: 因此，当你击吊袋时，它就朝着你弹回来。

sentences.english: The drummer beat the soldiers to arms.
Our song is the slamming screen door.
sentences.chinese: 我国首歌是砰击屏蔽门。

sentences.english: I guess I don't have to call you, now that I ran into you!
sentences.chinese: 既然我们萍水相逢了，我想就没必要击电话给你了。

sentences.english: Our rapid-response team beat it back.
sentences.chinese: 我们的快速反应小组把这项指责击了回去。

sentences.english: He was hit so bitterly that he could not help pitching forward.
sentences.chinese: 他被重重地击了一下，禁不住向前倒去。

sentences.english: To strike out with the foot or feet.
The hole I strikes the rifle is the sniper special-purpose breaks far to the high accuracy rifle.
sentences.chinese: 孔I击步枪是狙击手专用的远断离高精度步枪。

sentences.english: Smash the glass and press the button in emergency.
sentences.chinese: 遇到紧急情况时，击碎玻璃并摁下按钮。

sentences.english: Jump backward while you gouge, bandage when you are just right outside of his melee range.
sentences.chinese: 当你凿击的时候跳后，绷带当你正好再攻击范围以外。

definition: to eject/to exit from/to pop up
fence/railing/hurdle/column or box (of text or other data)
to hit/to press/to strike (on the keyboard)/to click (a web page button)
to jab/to poke/to stab/to sprain/to blunt/to fuck (vulgar)/to stand sth upright
to batter/combo (hit) (gaming)/(volleyball, table tennis etc) double hit/double contact
to search (a place)/to search (a database etc)
